Coverage: Identify and write tests for the 41.88% of code that is currently not covered. Focus on critical functions that handle edge cases.
Coverage: Add unit tests for all branches in the main function of the class, especially for error handling and boundary conditions.
Coverage: Ensure that all public methods in the class are tested, particularly those that interact with external systems or perform complex calculations.
Mutation: Create tests that specifically target the logic in the class methods to ensure that all mutants are killed. For example, if there are conditionals, test both true and false branches.
Mutation: Add tests that simulate unexpected inputs to the class methods to ensure robustness and improve mutation score.

Quality: Refactor the code to reduce complexity; consider breaking down large functions into smaller, more manageable ones.
